block.p: LEAD: * American Integrity Corp., Philadelphia, an insurance company, said it had retained Kidder, Peabody & Co. to explore alternatives to increase its capital base.
LEAD: * American Integrity Corp., Philadelphia, an insurance company, said it had retained Kidder, Peabody & Co. to explore alternatives to increase its capital base.
* American Integrity Corp., Philadelphia, an insurance company, said it had retained Kidder, Peabody & Co. to explore alternatives to increase its capital base.
* Cara Operations Ltd., Toronto, a food-service company, said it would purchase Grand & Toy for about $105 million, or $90.3 million in United States currency.
* British Steel P.L.C. received authorization from the European Community Commission to acquire C. Walker & Sons Ltd., Blackburn, England. Terms were not disclosed.
* W. R. Grace & Co., New York, announced it was seeking to sell its 81.8 percent interest in the Del Taco Restaurants chain to Tico Taco Inc. for an undisclosed amount.
* Home Bank, Signal Hill, Calif., said it would acquire Torrance National Bank for more than $17 million, or $29 a share.
* Indevo A.B., a Swedish management consultancy, said it would merge with Bain & Co., Inc., Boston, a management consulting firm, in a $50 million deal.
* Larmag Investments Group, Amsterdam, said it had acquired the Southland Center office and hotel complex in Dallas, in partnership with KTI Associates for $190 million.

* PCL Industries, Toronto, a furniture and home supplies company, said it would sell its furniture operations and equipment rental operations to Reeftor Industries for $44 million, or about $37.8 million in United States currency.
* Prince Manufacturing Inc., Princeton, N.J., a maker of tennis products, said it had retained Morgan Stanley & Co. as its financial adviser for the possible sale of the company.
* Uniquad, Las Vegas, Nev., signed an agreement to open four casinos in the Soviet Union in a joint venture with the Soviet Government.
* Star Enterprises, Houston, a petroleum refiner and distributor, said it would acquire 128 gasoline and martket outlets in Florida from TOC Retail Inc. Terms were not disclosed.
